article: One day I was hanging about with several friends. Not really doing anything _ , just doing what teenagers do on a hot summer afternoon. We were walking through a parking lot 32 _ my younger brother, Mark, came running up to us at full 33 _ . A few seconds later I saw a man running behind him. Mark was out of _ , so I didn't really understand what he was 35 _ . The man in front of me was 36 _ for Mark. Mark moved behind me, and I realised that he was 37 _ . I asked the man what the 38 _ . was. The man said he wanted my little brother in a bad way. He reached for my brother again and again but I 39 _ him. He then punched me in the chest. I felt more _ than hurt and I had to defend myself. 41 _ did the man know that I had been training in Karate for four years. I was _ by my parents to respect all adults, 43 _ this man was so terrible. He was trying to hurt my 44 _ ; he turned his anger to me with a 45 _ attack. But, much to his surprise, he found he was in a bit of trouble himself. So the man 46 _ his attack and disappeared from my sight. The whole thing was over a simple disagreement 47 _ two children, namely Mark and the man's daughter. This man had _ overreacted and did things without finding out the facts. I am happy that no one was hurt badly and that 49 _ worked out okay. However, the man and I were similar in a way. We both tried to 50 _ the ones we care about in the best way we could.
